info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 21 at 9:56PM CDT until June 21 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN DICKENS AND SOUTHWESTERN MOTLEY COUNTIES... At 955 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 6 miles northwest of Afton, or 12 miles south of Matador, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Dickens and southwestern Motley Counties. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for northwestern Texas. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
